headline: Stef's Super Cheesy Garlic Bread
description: Two types of cheese are mixed with green onions, garlic, and mayonnaise to make one incredible, and super cheesy, garlic bread.
name: Stef's Super Cheesy Garlic Bread
recipeIngredient: 1 (1 pound) loaf French bread, halved lengthwise

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Combine the butter, mayonnaise, green onions, garlic, Parmesan cheese, and Monterey Jack cheese in a large bowl. Cut each half of French bread into 4 pieces. Spread the cheese mixture evenly on the bread pieces.
Bake in the preheated oven for 8 minutes. Set the oven to broil; broil until hot and bubbly, about 2 additional minutes.

review.reviewBody: I really DO NOT CARE if u comment that this is not particularly healthy….really I’m an adult and I know already. With that said I absolutely was the hit at dinner with friends when I brought this. It’s not like I would eat it everyday, though I would love too, so it’s a real party in my mouth when I do make it.

I made this to use up day old baguettes and they came out great! I also used different cheeses I had in my fridge - Parmesan, cheddar, and jack. I really liked the garlic and green onion, too. This will definitely be better with French bread per the recipe. This would be great to feed a crowd because it’s quick and easy. I can’t wait to try this recipe again!
Reminds me of Hy’s cheese bread.
Fantastic and so cheesy. I assembled it and put it in the freezer the day before I cooked it pulled it out of the freezer and it turned out wonderful.
I added more cheese and leaves

I make this every year for Thanksgiving and I'm back again to make it this week. I look forward to this recipe every year! There is never any leftovers of these. My kids always request this bread but It's only allowed on Thanksgiving.

This recipe is quick, easy and foolproof. My husband is a really picky eater and he loved this version of garlic bread, and suggested I make it for our even pickier friends the next time they visit. I followed the recipe exactly as shown.
made it for a benefit dinner and it was a huge hit everyone loved it, a very good option.
my family loved this so much!! thank you!!

This was amazing! I used a 16oz french baguette but will probably use bread with more 'bread' next time (if that makes sense??). The topping seemed like a lot but it really sank into the bread and was just delicious. I used unsalted butter, but added a couple turns of salt to the mixture. Also used Mozzarella instead of Monterey Jack and chives instead of green onion (only because I had chives). I will make this again and again!

Iv been making this for years, I originally got it from a church cookbook. But for the recipe I have, you put the spread on each half of the bread, Then wrap each half in Saran Wrap and chill it for a few hours (or over night). Iv tried it both ways and chilling it is the best. It puffs when you bake it and the over all texture is better!
This is the best! If you're worried about the fat content, use low fat ingredients - there really isn't that much difference in taste to not give it a try.
This recipe is so good, I have made it 3 times now and is just so amazing!

This bread was a huge hit at my house. I'll be honest I'm not much of a cook but pairing this with the slow-cooker lasagna I make, and everyone was impressed! I just have to take a second to say, I DO NOT get the people writing bad reviews because it's not healthy. I know you are all smart enough to have realized that before you made it, if you did even make it (and if you didn't, you shouldn't be reviewing it anyway). If something this heavy, rich (ie delicious) makes you have a heart attack just thinking about it, move on, go find a recipe for tofurkey or something. 

This recipe was EXCELLENT. Yum! I did make a few tweaks to it though. I used a 1lb Italian loaf from the local grocer. Omitted the onions. I did use the 1/2 c. of butter, but I cut the mayo down to 1/2 c. as well. I added in 1/2 t. of garlic powder along with the 3 cloves of minced garlic, and I think next time I'll even add in maybe a 1/2 t. of garlic salt. For the cheese I used 1 c. of cheddar, 1 c. of mozzarella, 1/2 c. of a shredded Italian mix, and then another 1/4 c. of shredded parm. I wasn't sure how it would turn out mixing everything together and spreading it on instead of starting with the butter, then putting mayo on, followed by a cheese topping. Mixing it all together was great and had the same or better result than layering it all on individually. This recipe was simple and delicious. Yes, it's a little decadent, but we could all use that sometimes.
This was a huge hit. It doesn't even need dip. All my guests were begging me to tell them why it was so moist, I didn't think they wanted to know the secret ingredient is mayonnaise.

I had made garlic cheesy bread similar to this about 20 years ago, so I was happy to see this one. I made this today on a whim and discovered if you're in a pinch, dried chives work as long as you reconstitute them in the Mayo before putting everything together. Pretty good recipe!
Amazeballs!!!!
So delicious
I liked it, will definitely make again. Only problem I had no Monterey Jack on hand so I used cheddar and provolone. Next time I’ll be prepared and have the correct cheese. Still turned out good,

This was amazing!!! This was the first thing I made on here and it went really well with my parmesean Chicken. The garlic cloves were a tad much imo, I think it would've turned out even better if I would've used garlic salt instead.
I made this as a side dish, but ended up just eating this as my meal. It was great!
Reminds me of cheesy-garlic bread from a certain steak house. Not health food but so good on occasion. I think you could cut down on butter and mayo and still be good.

I loveddddd this!! It is super cheesy and rich, definitely a hit! I got the $1 French bread from Walmart and it was so delicious. I enjoyed the richness and flavors of the bread, I was full after two slices! I used light mayo which made me feel a little bit healthier. My mom said if you add some pepperoni and serve with a salad it would be a delicious pizza! Thank you!

Excellent, a whole bunch of green peppers was a little too much for me would cut this in half next time.
I left half the topping covered in the fridge so i could quickly make the second half of bread fresh to eat with my left overs.
This recipe is perfect as is. I have made it several times, tried tweaking this way and that way, but its best as is!!
Add more mayo

I like my garlic bread crispy. A thick layer of spread on the bread would make it soft on the surface.
So, I used half the cheese spread's ingredients and it was plenty gooey and cheesy, without loosing the crunch. Also seasoned with some salt and pepper.

This combo of ingredients was fabulous! Got to use your common sense on this one, though. Think about it. If you are only doing 1 loaf of bread as I was the quantities are a little much. I used, 1/2 cup mayo, 1/2 cup butter, and 1/2 cup parmesan cheese (no other cheese with it), along with the other ingredients and it was amazing!! Will definitely make this one again!!
Amazing. Rave reviews every time I make it!

Wow, this is fabulous! Unbelievably good. I made exactly as written except I didn't have green onions so I used chives instead. Definitely not low fat, but if you're wanting low fat chances are you're not going to be making garlic bread anyway. Very nice to make for company-1 or two pieces per person is a good portion since it's so rich. Will definitely be making again!

This was absolutely delicious! A couple of things I did differently...I used 1 1/2 cups of shredded Colby-Jack cheese and 5 oz container of shredded Parmesan cheese. I used all of the other ingredients as recommended. My French bread was previously frozen and halfway thawed out before I cut it and added the cheesy garlic topping. I may have let mine remain in the broil phase an extra 2 minutes (until the cheese started lightly browning). The family LOVED IT! My 9-year-old daughter and 66-year-old grandmother both asked for the recipe!
My hubby loves this recipe
Only change was cheddar instead of jack and omitted the green onions. Best bread I've ever made!

VERY GOOD. Used 2 cups of Jack cheese and used 1 1/2 cups of Parmesan cheese, and 5 garlic. A little salty. Maybe use
unsalted butter next time or just put in less cheese and follow the amount from the recipe.
Reduced the recipe to two servings and put on a small split gluten free baguette. Wow! I dipped this in some leftover pasta sauce. It was a wonderful lunch.
Best garlic bread ever!
delicious and super cheesy! Loved it!Will make again!
So so good!!!!!!

A family hit and a must have for any Italian dinner nights! Only modifications I made was cut the butter in half and used a mixture of Mayo and Sour Cream vs straight Mayo. I used Italian seasoning in place of the onions and threw in a hand-full of Mozzarella cheese to the mix. So cheesy and flavorful.
Best garlic bread I've ever had!!
This is great! It was a big hit for my dad's 89th birthday. It's great for a snack too!
I would of gave it a 5 but I did not add the onions. Instead used 1/4 tsp. Onion powder, sprinkle of nutmeg, hungarian sweet paprika, dried parsley, salt. Best me and my boyfriend ever had!

OMG!! Followed the recipe exactly other than halving since there are only two of us. This recipe was AWESOME but probably won't make again simply because it's not a healthy side...but had to try it...and so glad I did

I made this to go with a spaghetti dinner and it's incredibly delicious. Even my super picky son inhaled it. I only wish I wasn't so full so I could eat more of it. (I substituted shredded mozzarella for the Monterey jack and didn't have scallions. I also added black pepper, dried oregano and dried basil.)
great recipe made for homeless dinner, attendees came back for 2nds/3rds.
Only thing I changed was I used Greek yogurt instead of mayo. This recipe is perfect! Yumm mers! There's no picture because we are it all!
Yum! Absolutely delicious! made with stuffed Italian shells and the loaf was gone. Am making it again tonight.
This was delicious! Only thing I probably did differently was to add more garlic and green onions. That's it! This is the only way I'll make garlic bread now.

This was good, but a tad too rich for my taste with all the butter and mayo. I like rich and cheesy so it has tons of potential. One could probably cut back on the butter and 1/4-1/2 cup on the mayo and it would not be missed. Also it was a bit salty with cheese, mayo and salted butter. So I recommend using unsalted butter.
This stuff is so delicious. Had company for dinner and we were fighting over the last piece! Eat some of this and then do some time on the Stairmaster!
I have made this before and it is awesome tasting. Just don't have it every day or week and you will be fine. It's a treat for you and guests. Thanks Stef.
Just made this and it was delish. Everyone loved it and I wouldn't change a thing. Super cheesy and the fresh garlic was yumm. Will make again.
Can use less topping. Bill and Mark liked this - Snow Day, January 6, 2014
This garlic bread is no joke. All my friends ask for it for their birthdays and if I bring it to school it is all gone within 2 minutes (no exaggeration). Try it and see for yourself!

The concept is good but WAAAAY too much fat. The second time I made it I used 1/4 c butter, 2 T olive oil and 2 - 3 T mayo. The mayo was still overpowering. I will cut it down more or omit altogether.
I'm pregnant and could have eaten the whole loaf ! I did half the mayo and cheeses and there was plenty. Thanks!
Very nice and whips up in a snap!

This garlic bread is delicious! I used to buy frozen garlic bread every week for pasta night, and I realized I was wasting a lot of money. This is so easy and SO much better than anything you'll ever buy frozen!

OH MY! I knew this would be rich and be well received by my family....but they inhaled it! I didn't hear any chewing! I cut most of the ingredients in half and still found it to be satisfying and hearty! Was a delicious side to my home made chicken soup.
Very tasty
Very tasty
Mmmmm-hmmmm! Loved it! I followed it exactly, only I halved it to make four good-sized servings. It was a big hit here- dee-lish-ous!!! Thanks STEFANY21- I will be making this often!
I made this with a slow cooker Clam Chowder, and it was a big HIT! Easy to make... I loved it... will definitely do this again... thank you for this fantastic recipe!

All I can say is awesome! I took the recommendation of other reviewers and used 1/2 cup each of mayo and butter. The cheese I used was a mix of shredded Colby and Monterey Jack as well as the Parm. Yum!

Holy cow....heavy on the tummy, but gooey, cheesy and garlicky is the best way to enjoy garlic bread! Next time, I'll just eyeball all the ingredients, as I don't think flavor will be sacrificed at all by drastically reducing the butter and mayo, and I love butter and mayo! I used some minced garlic as well as a healthy sprinkling of garlic and onion powders. Didn't have green onions, so I used dried chives, which I'd do again. Also, I didn't have a loaf of french bread, so out of sheer desperation, I used a package of King's Hawaiian rolls sliced lengthwise. I slathered up both sides and forged on with the recipe. Not bad in a pinch, but I'll make sure to have a loaf of french bread on hand next time I make this! Served with AR's Hearty Minestrone soup, this sinfully delicious garlic bread was thoroughly enjoyed by myself, hubby, and 4 year-old daughter. An occasional splurge for sure, I'll hold on to this recipe.
Easy to make and such a guilty pleasure! I seldom make this but when I do, it never lasts. Is best right out of the oven and I didn't change a thing.
This was very good. Definitely our go to garlic bread recipe. I do omit the onions though. And watch this in the oven, it it overflows onto the bottom it will smoke like crazy. Trust me. ;)

I tried this. Amazing amazing!!! Followed it right to the letter. It's perfect the way it is. I am sure it will go over well for any party cut into bite size pieces. Yes, it's heavy, but I'm sure it will go a long way with my friends and family. Great with spaghetti and sauce. Love it!
Very Awesome Bread... this will be a regular menu item at my house !!
Yummy

I've made this recipe for a party and for company and both times everyone raved about it and it was the first thing to go. I made it as posted. You could probably tweak the amount of butter or mayo and it would probably be just as good. Don't miss this one. Everyone wanted the recipe after trying it.
good but a little too cheesey

I made this recipe as written for dinner guest and got rave reviews! I made this for a second time tonight using margarine and mayo with olive oil. It was just as delicious as the first time, and a tiny bit healthier!

Woah...this is RICH! Definitely not for the health conscious! I think one whole loaf of French bread is a little much because with this as rich and fatty as it is, a small slice goes a long way. I did add a little garlic salt along with the minced garlic. This is really tasty right out of the oven but again, a little goes a LONG way.

A huge hit with my family and friends! I made it to
accompany grilled salmon and broccoli salad. Delicious, lots of rave reviews!

You do not need the butter, the mayo has enough oils and fat to to the job. Also place a few slices of fresh or jarred jalpeno in. Can use on any fish as well, replace the butter with more parm. cheese, will make any dry fish very moist and tasty!

Rich and delicious for an occasional splurge.

I wish people would stop rating recipes on ingredients or health-consciousness alone - it's really annoying, we're all old enough to see it's not healthy and not for everyday, for Pete's sake!!!
try mixing olive oil with the butter and using sour cream instead of mayonnaise, totally fabulous and you are lightening some of the calories, also try lite sour cream
that was so good it should be illegal

I've been making this for years. My mother-in-law gave me the recipe but she calls it Monterey Bread. I don't usually have green onions on hand so don't use them and I use lots of garlic powder and whatever cheese I have on hand. My kids love it and we never have leftovers!

There was a wonderful restaurant in Tucson called Chads. They made this on French bread brushing it first with buttermilk. That would eliminate the need for mayo. Then use any cheese that you like. This recipe as is I've been making for years using Banguette. Perfect appetizer that way or on French with supper. This is such a keeper. Don't miss tryng this one.
This recipe is delicious, although I make it with equal parts butter and mayo and add more garlic than called for.

My family of teens and adults absolutely raved about this bread! I made the whole recipe as directed but used only half of it for a long skinny loaf of French bread. I'll use the other half for dinner tomorrow night as my family asked me to make it again! One loaf served 5 with some having seconds.

This bread is so awesome. Use whatever cheese(s) you like. I omit the green onions as our family doesn't like them. I use garlic salt insted of minced garlic (just my preference). When we have dinner guests, this is usually on the menu by their request. Everyone loves this bread, even people who don't like mayo. Btw, someone rated this 2 stars because of the ingredients. Why give a bad rating without trying the recipe just because of the calorie content? That's insane. If it's not for you, move on, don't rate the recipe low. This bread is DELISH!
So delicious! My children and their friends were upset when the bread was gone.
Reallllly good. Really unhealthy.... but really good.
Excellent!
Yum Yum Yum!!! Great garlic cheese bread!!!
I thought there was a bit too much mayo. Next time I will only use half the amount. I also added some oregeno. Nice Touch.

Wow - "Super Cheesy" alright! This is definitely not for the health conscious or for those counting calories! I don't even want to know how many calories or fat grams are in this because it was just so darn cheesy, buttery, and just plain good. I mean we're talkin' delish with a capital "D" here. I used Hellman's light mayo and reduced fat cheese just so I wouldn't feel too bad about eating so much of this. My husband and I devoured this - can't wait to make it again! Not too soon though as I'd like to fit into my clothes... Thanks for a great recipe STEFANY21!
VERY RICH!!!!

Wouldn't have this often as it's heavy and rich and clearly not the best nutrition-wise either. But as an occasional splurge in small portions this was a mouth-watering, gooey, cheesy treat to accompany our main dish salad tonight. With the exception of cutting back on the mayonnaise significantly, I followed the recipe fairly closely, eyeballing ingredients and sprinkling the cheese with ground pepper before broiling.
This was very good! The only change I would make next time, is to leave out the onions. It way over powered the cheese and garlic flavor. Will make again!
A nice garlic bread with good flavor, very rich and filling, but the flavor could easily overpower the main dish.
Followed the recipe exactly. Used roasted garlic in the glass jar. Perfect if you don't like dry, ordinary bread. So Yummy!
WOW! This takes garlic bread to a whole new stratosphere! It is worth every single mega-caloric morsel - indeed!
Most of us liked it. My daughter said it was too cheesy. I will make it again but not for awhile.

the best cheesiest garlic bread around. I really wanted to make this, but didn't have a french loaf, so I mixed all the ingredients and just put it on old hamburger and hot dog buns....super awesome! thanks Stef for a recipe that my family went cuckoo over!
This got rave reviews from everyone. I used havarti cheese.
